content: Yes, that is correct. Release and Reclaim Religious Recovery Group has a team of facilitators who are helping professionals with lived experience of religious trauma. The facilitators include Dr. Marlene Winell, who is the founder of Journey Free and a leading expert on Religious Trauma Syndrome (RTS). The group also includes Christine Chenitz, a master’s degree in Social Work and currently has a psychotherapy practice where she works with those who have experienced trauma of various types including religious and spiritual trauma and adverse religious experiences. Janice Selbie, a Registered Professional Counsellor, who was born and raised in a Canadian evangelical Christian home and experienced a series of tragedies which caused her sufficient doubt in the God of the Bible and prompted her to start researching other religions and exploring all that she had denied herself. Coco Owen, a licensed psychologist in Los Angeles, who grew up in the Seventh-day Adventist Church, and Kevin Davison, a facilitator who recalls an early Southern Illinois Pentecostal church, where he first spoke in tongues after a laying on of hands in the children’s church basement. Chase Marks, a former Jehovah's Witness, who after leaving the religion in his mid-20s, he faced the reality of losing his family, friends, community, worldview, and sense of self. He began his healing journey and began working with and studying under traditional healers and medicine people. They lead group discussions and provide support on Zoom conference calls twice a month.
